mechanoreception.notes: As copepods parasitic on fishes, Ergasilidae likely use mechanoreception to detect water currents and host proximity. This is inferred due to their parasitic lifestyle.

chemoreception.notes: Chemoreception is likely used to detect host cues and locate suitable attachment sites on fish. This is inferred due to their parasitic lifestyle.

vision.notes: The extent and functionality of vision in Ergasilidae are unknown. More research is needed to assess visual capabilities in this family.
